article.title: Fluctuation theorems in feedback-controlled open quantum systems: quantum coherence and absolute irreversibility

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main topic of this scientific article?
choices: Quantum information theory and entanglement
The effect of quantum coherence on fluctuation theorems in open quantum systems
The efficiency of quantum heat engines
The mathematical properties of thermal operations

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the operator L<sub>kl</sub>(λ) represent in the Lindblad equation?
choices: The time-dependent driving of the system
The energy of the system
A quantum jump of the system due to interaction with the environment
The detailed balance condition

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the meaning of  ψ  in the context of quantum trajectories?
choices: A single energy eigenstate of the system
The thermal equilibrium state of the system
A sequence of energy measurements on the system
A single realization of the system\'s evolution in Hilbert space

multiple_choice_question.text: In the protocol of feedback control, what does the measurement operator M<sub>a</sub> represent?
choices: The projective energy measurement performed at the beginning of the process.
The time-reversed operation of the Hamiltonian.
A specific measurement operator from a set, applied at time t<sub>m</sub>, dependent on the outcome \'a\'.
The energy change of the system due to interaction with the environment.

multiple_choice_question.text: Why is post-selection crucial in the backward process of the feedback-controlled quantum system?
choices: To ensure the normalization of probability without unphysical events by selectively evolving the state.
To determine the initial energy and state of the system in the time-reversed process.
To calculate the joint probability distribution of the quantum trajectory and measurement outcome.
To drive the system according to the time-reversed protocol λ<sub>t</sub> and h<sub>t</sub>.
